Articles.Content:
So I have found myself bombarded by real life recently and I am finding less and less time to play the game

I figure that, if I could come up with some short missions around 15min playtime then I would be able to still have lots of fun playing the game while not burning into time I need for IRL stuff.

So here are the things I have come up with:

  1. Build a REALLY fast plane
  2. Build a silly/unflyable rocket and try to fly it.
  3. Just go to orbit.
  4. Race to the mÃƒÂ¼n
  5. Test small craft as part of a larger mission
  6. Design craft as part of a larger mission
  7. Try and build a boat (I still cant make a good one)
  8. Mess around with the cheats! (hack gravity/infinate fuel)

Do you guys have any suggestions? these will only keep me going for so long...
Make a really fast, unflyable rocket that gets to orbit and can race to the mun with small craft as a part of it and its also a boat and you can't cheat.
Maybe build a space station? One part at a time.

Build a plane/rover that can fly/drive upside down as well as right-side up.

Just run around in a rover, trying to get good air time.

Build a plane/rover that can fly/drive upside down as well as right-side up.

Just run around in a rover, trying to get good air time.

All my SSTO planes are like that. Heck. Even one of my rovers that was transported by said SSTO planes is like that too.

Knock up a rover and take it for a spin round KSC. There's some neat stuff there, and all round it's probably the most detailed area in the whole game.

Do a free return Mun flyby. All you need to do is make orbit, set up and make one precise burn (about 850-900 m/s dV), then hit the timewarp and watch.

Try and crash two rockets into each other.

Download the Rollcage mod, and see if you can make a dragster that can keep your Kerbal alive in a bad crash. I usually run off the runway (build in SPH) to the right, hitting the hump where the elevated spaceport terrain meets the surrounding terrain to create my crashes...

My Dragster..

Fatal...

Non-Fatal!

The trick is to make a quicksave before you start making runs, so you can just F9 after each run. Quick setup after the building of your car, and tons of fun! Some really hilarious accidents, and some were really cool and realistic looking. Mostly hilarious, though.

Edited March 12, 2014 by Werwolf

Have you simply walked or driven around and explored KSC? There are many interesting little details on and around those buildings.

The island runway has some fun things to investigate as well. Also, the planets are really pretty. Sometimes I like to go back to a satellite I've previously put in orbit of one of them, and just watch the terrain roll by.

Make a 10-minute taxi ("the car will be with you in 10 minutes" ranks alongside "the cheque's in the post" and other standard lies) -

1) Pick a spot on the map of Kerbin

2) Launch/take-off from KSC

3) Land at your selected spot within 10 minutes (met)

Yes, you should be able to do it with a sub-orbital ship/plane. Popping into space for a while is up to you.
I like to build military style jets

I have one saved game in which I have 4 ships with 2 EVA kerbals each going in highly elliptic orbits out to Jool and inside Moho. While I'm doing something else (i.e. work) I run it in map mode, focused on the sun, at full time warp, and wait for interesting intersects to happen... It's like a screensaver for physics geeks.

Make the smallest SSTO you can!

Make a Sun station!

Tiny Ship

Command Seat

See how tiny you can make a ship and still get a Kerbal to orbit. Half the challenge is just figuring out how to get the guy into the seat on the launchpad .... but it also makes for fun times.

Kerbal Kamping!

Build a weekend retreat for the Kerbal crew near the obilesk near the KSC. Make a habitat space, transport it out there, and then make a rover bus to transport Kerbals out and back. See how "homey" you can make it for the gang. They work hard, they deserve some luxory.

I bet u could unlock the whole tech tree with probes in 15 minute sessions. Overbuild the engines to keep burn time to a minimum. Mainsails only kind of thing. With an asparagus launcher saved as a subassembly u could get a probe to most places in 15 minutes and transmit the yummy science back.
See how many Kerbals you can safely get Eva on the Mun or Minimum in 15 minutes then try and beat it. I got 18 on my first attempt.

Develop a vehicle for finding and landing at the anomalies around Kerbin.

Don't just get to orbit, race to orbit. What is the highest acceleration you can put on your vehicle and still put it in at least 75km orbit. Keep iterating and trying to best it. Just how quickly can you get shock heating? (Yes, I'm talking absurd TWR)
Create ultra-maneuverable spacecraft by spamming reaction wheels:
Create a rocket that can get into orbit with only 0.5 meter parts.
Maybe you can spend some time with this. The author need test pilots .
Create a rocket that can get into orbit with only 0.5 meter parts.

Vehicle with a good suspension. Using the ibeams as part of the suspension to allow more flex. Mix between long control arms from the center and wishbone suspension on the wheel it self.

Freelancer advanced train remake

B2 bomber

At last my sun...satellite.
OP, done anything fun?

Updated mini ship all 0.5 parts. Capable of going anywhere short of a suicide plunge into Kerban.

Note, core engine not fired and was actually more spin stable when not in use.
